intro: Lyperanthus sarasinianus, commonly known as the Sarasin's lily, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Eastern Himalayas. It is a member of the Iridaceae family, which includes irises and related genera. The plant produces showy, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale blue in color. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
